title: Whats the definition of getting S in game?

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body: I get 13/1/4 and I get A-, how can we actually get S in game? Even Yasuo 10/3/3 get S-.{{champion:22}}

replies.body:
Your farm is terrible. Even as a Jungler, I'm out csing you. Farm has quite a big impact. 

One game I went 7/3 (not very good), but got an S because I had about 300 cs on a Jungler in a 40 min game.

You seem to have 76 cs in a 22 min game. That's how much cs I have at about 13 mins in.

There isn't a set criteria you need to achieve. For good reason too, can you imagine games where people are completely ignoring their teams just so they can get x farm, x objective assists and eventually x/x/x KDA? 

In the end, the grade you receive is based on the[ **same champ** in the **same role**](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery) compared to everyone else on the server. You have to be in the top x% of players playing whichever champion in whichever role (they treat annie mid and annie support differently for example).

In this particular case I can definitely see your CS being your biggest downfall, with you having 75 cs (which is what should be aiming for at 10 minutes) at the end of a 22 minute game.

To get an S rank you have to report  and successfully get him banned.

Thats why no one gets S ranks anymore, because the report system doesnt do fucking anything.
